bibl.title: List of Volunteers for the Yellow Fever Experiments, [1901?]

div1.p: These three notes list the human-experiment volunteers who were exposed to fomites, infected by injections of blood, and infected by mosquitoes.

div1.head: List of Volunteers for the Yellow Fever Experiments, [1901?]
div1.p:
Feb. 5th 1900
Sept 25th 1900
Feb. 8th 1899 Baltimore
Aug 23th 1900 Boston
Aug 2nd 1874 Modesto
Cal

Exposed to fomites,
1. Dr R. P. Cooke, A. A. Surg.
2. Levi E. Folk.
3. Warren G. Jernegan
4. James L. Hanberry
5. Edward Weatherwalk Bitten once - negative
Refused after Hanberry
came down.
6. James Hildebrand offered himself but was
declined on account of his age.
7. Thomas M. England.
Carrolls handwriting
PSH

Infected by Mosquitoes
Taken sick
1. James Carroll, Aug. 31, 1900
American soldier
2. X-Y, F. Cary, C(?) Sept. 6 "
3. John J. Kissinger, Dec. 8 "
4. Nicanor Fernandez, Dec. 13 "
5. Antonio Benigno, Dec. 13 "
6. Becente Presedo, Dec. 15 "
7. John J. Moran, Dec. 25 "
8. Josè Martinez, Jan'y 3d, 1901.
9. Levi E. Folk, Jan'y 23 "
10. Clyde L. West, Feb'y 3 "
11. James L. Hanberry Feb'y 9 "
12. Charles G. Sontag Feb'y 10 "
- - - -
13. Pablo Ruis Castillo Sept. 19, 1901
14. Jacinto Mendez Alvarez Oct. 13 "
Ruiz

Infected by Injections of Blood,
Taken sick
1. Warren G. Jernegan Jan'y 8, 1901.
2. William Olsen " 11 "
3. Wallace Forbes " 24 "
4. John H. Andrus " 28 "
- - - - -
5. Manuel Gutierrez Moran Oct. 20, 1901.
6. John R. Bullard Oct. 23 "
- - - - -
Infected by Injections of Filtered Blood Serum.

1. P. Hamann Oct. 19, 1901.
23 Batt.
C. A.
2. A. W. Covington Oct. 19, 1901.
